description:
At Moffitt Cancer Center, we strive to be the leader in understanding the complexity of cancer and applying these insights to contribute to the prevention and cure of cancer. Our diverse team of over 9,000 are dedicated to serving our patients and creating a workspace where every individual is recognized and appreciated. For this reason, Moffitt has been recognized on the 2023 Forbes list of America’s Best Large Employers and America’s Best Employers for Women, Computerworld magazine’s list of 100 Best Places to Work in Information Technology, DiversityInc Top Hospitals & Health Systems and continually named one of the Tampa Bay Time’s Top Workplace. Additionally, Moffitt is proud to have earned the prestigious Magnet® designation in recognition of its nursing excellence. Moffitt is a National Cancer Institute-designated Comprehensive Cancer Center based in Florida, and the leading cancer hospital in both Florida and the Southeast. We are a top 10 nationally ranked cancer center by Newsweek and have been nationally ranked by U.S. News & World Report since 1999.
Working at Moffitt is both a career and a mission: to contribute to the prevention and cure of cancer. Join our committed team and help shape the future we envision.

Summary

Position Highlights:

The Research Data Analyst II (Bioinformatics) will be responsible for conducting bioinformatics analyses requiring 2 years of experience programming in Stata, SAS, R, Python, or other bioinformatic software packages under supervision of Principal Investigators from the Health Outcomes and Behavior and Cancer Epidemiology Programs. This position would support Moffitt’s Cancer Care Delivery lab ( https://lab.moffitt.org/cancercaredelivery/ ). Examples of projects include 1) pragmatic clinical trials evaluating the effectiveness of supportive care interventions for individuals with cancer and 2) mixed methods studies to examine disparities in care delivery for individuals with cancer.

The Ideal Candidate: The ideal candidate will have a degree in health services research, health policy, economics, quantitative psychology, epidemiology or a related field and have prior experience working with diverse data types commonly used in health service research (e.g., insurance claims, complex survey, electronic health record, patient-reported outcomes). Stata programming skills are preferred but we are open to hiring candidates with experience using other statistical software packages.

Responsibilities:
• Under the supervision of the PI, conducts advanced analysis requiring programming in Stata, SAS, R, Python, or other relevant statistical software package. Analysis may include but is not limited to survival analysis, case‐control analyses, cohort analyses, etc.
• Performs bioinformatic data quality control prior to analysis implementation.
• Determines appropriate statistical methods to achieve project aims.
• Collects and manages survey, insurance claims, and clinical data. Develops custom databases with oversight from the PI.
• Collects big data from multiple resources and determining appropriate merging procedures with existing analytic data.
• Reviews data, ensuring accuracy and completeness of data.
• Assures adherence to quality control standards established for data management.
• Assists in scientific interpretation and writing/reporting of research for publication.
• Effectively communicates the results of analyses to researchers.
• Summarizes complex analyses in visual form that is interpretable by many levels of expertise, including clinicians.
• Document all stages of data cleaning, analysis and visualization with an eye towards reproducibility.
• Serves as contact for co‐investigators and other research affiliates.
• Performs literature and software tool searches. Reads, summarizes and implements applicable relevant findings.
• Under the direction of the PI, coordinates and develops correspondence and responses to various outside agencies regarding research activities.

Credentials and Qualifications:
• Master’s degree in health services research, health policy, economics, quantitative psychology, epidemiology, biostatistics, bioinformatics, computer science, computational biology or related field with 2 years of relevant experience with bioinformatic packages is required.
• Or Bachelor’s Degree in related field and 7 years of relevant experience with bioinformatic packages is required.
• Completion of an intense data boot camp is equivalent to 1 year of experience.
• Experience programming in Stata, R, Python, SAS or some other statistical software required.

Equal Employment Opportunity
Moffitt Cancer Center is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, or protected veteran or disabled status. We seek candidates whose skills, and personal and professional experience, have prepared them to contribute to our commitment to diversity and excellence.
Reasonable Accommodation
Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. Moffitt endeavors to make moffitt.org/careers accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact one of the Human Resources receptionists by phone at 813-745-7899 or by email at HRReceptionists@moffitt.org. This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications. If you’d like more information on your EEO rights under the law, please click here.
